Reviews.Title: “Nl Hotel Leidseplein”
Reviews.Author: Michele R
Reviews.Content: was a quite disappointed with this hotel the photos on the Spendia website must of been taken some time ago although the rooms were kept clean they are quite shabby but not in a chic way, for the price I wouldnt class this as a 3 star hotel more like a 2 star motel, the hall ways are very smelly and could really do with a a fresh lick of paint and please dont stay here if your scared of very narrow steep stairs, (take your hiking pole your goning to need it) the website never advised re the stairs, the walls are very thin you can hear everyting in the next room and yes I mean everything, the hotel is in great location but unfortunately I wont be staying there again maybe ok for one night but seriously not for anymore mattresses could do with changing I think they have out done there years of use. this is purely my opinion of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Feyyazesat
Reviews.Content: I came Amsterdam for 15 days travel I stayed here for 10â‚¬ and stayed in 8 bed room there wasn't anyone I stayed alone :) and breakfast included, coffe, juice, tea it was cheap and very nice :) I recommend here for everyone. And leidseplein is a nice pleace heineken pubs, coffee shops, Hard Rock Coffee, burger king and Mc donalds and so many places here just 10 minute walk to arrive Dam Square, Redlight district and somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “LEIDSEPLEIN HOTEL ..A COMPLETE NIGHTMARE !!”
Reviews.Author: Alastair W
Reviews.Content: this place is dirty, falling to bits,wallpaper hanging off walls in room and on staircase,the room had one old twel for usage room 14 ,,,was unironede and with a complimentary hole in it...the lights didnt work apart from 1 of them the first night room 14 then switched to room 10 with 2 lights not working and a tv that didnt work....the people who w work thewre must not give a damn,and those Romanian staff, were friendly...the stablishment is in dire need of complete refurbishment..........Never A again!!!no non no !!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: Not being funny but 25euros a night you will not find anywhere better cheaper

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lauren p
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel' is more of a hostel than a hotel. The only good thing is the location. When we arrived the receptionist practically grunted and thre us the keys - we went shown to our room & had 2 hunt for it. The room was dirty, smelly noisy & riddled with fleas & bedbugs. It handnt been cleaned since the last visitors. The curtains were hanging off, Nets were absolutly filthy brown colour, windows didnt work - Only one opened and the others were open a fraction and we couldnt shut them. The bedside table was full of rubbish as were the wardrobes, The bed sheets were viel. The towels were about as old as the 70's dated decor. Shower was filthy i felt more dirty when i came out. We didnt sleep in the beds just slept on top of them. I had to lay towels down on the floor as i was scared to walk on the carpets. we raided the cleaners cupboard 2 find clean sheets/towels but they were all as dirty as the ones we were supplied with. We also was not told the hotel was above a NIGHTCLUB!!! If it wasnt for the weed we would not have slept at all!! And for some twatish reason the whole street dicided to empty its glass bins at 5 in the morning - EVERY morning! Worst hotel i have every stayed in. the only people i reccomend this to is to the homeless.

Reviews.Title: “Not any good”
Reviews.Author: mol21
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this so-called hotel is its location. Otherwise everything's much more worse than descriped on the website: rooms are worn out, carpet full of burn marks, bathroom is leaky and wi-fi isn't working at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible abode”
Reviews.Author: Murray R
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews my wife and i knew what to expect - a basic hotel in a great location. This does not change and i reinforce the sentiment, however.... I can put up with the basic nature (as it really is just a stopping point) and the room/hotel certainly fits the bill. The decor reasonably clean and bland with a tv and what appeared to be clean crisp linen. The towels seemed to have been improved from earlier reports so on the surface all is acceptable. (Oh, and cheap by Amsterdam standards is not necessary cheap by other measures (320e for 3 nights in Sept) as your average Premier/Travel Lodge is far better value and 10 times cleaner) Anyway, the net curtains contained a designed/pattern borne from cigarette burns and I can only assume the designer was partaking of the amsterdam herbal. The Curtains were hanging off the rail too. Come on Leidseplein how much is a new net curtain and a 5 minute curtain fix? The worse however was the unpaying guests that lived within the matresses. Yes, i have brought home 15 bedbug bites from the infested, but at first look clean bed. I make no judgement for others but make your own mind up, me, NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: JDavis1007
Reviews.Content: This place got the job done...If you're like me then you don't need much more than a bed and a pillow because you don't plan on spending much time in a hotel room! It was cheap, I LOVED the location, the folks were nice.

Reviews.Title: “love amsterdam for new years eve ...buzzing..city... hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ekabutts
Reviews.Content: hotel clean and airy big rooms too tv wardrobes and breakfast included...excellant location in the heart of leidseplien were its all happeninng from now on on nye ... as there is no longer a fire work display and live dj and count down in dam square now its next to leidsplien near the van gough museum now and its huge live bands playing up to date music and a beer tent jus like a real festivel the atmorsphere is buzzing best nye we have ever had in amsterdam hence why we have been going for the last 8 yrs hotel friendly staff had a great laugh and drink with owners on arriving in at 2pm would go back again to this hotel due to it location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Calypso1806
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend (3 nights ) in this hotel with some friends. We weren't expecting much as we did book the cheapest we could find in the center. The rooms seemed like nothing had been changed since the 70' (the curtains were ripped and the carpet had stains). On the other hand the bedding was clean, the beds were really comfortable (there were 4 of us in the same room and we all slept like babies), shower was fine and the we did have running warm water. It was all we needed, especially that our room looked the other way (not facing the street) so it was no noisy at all. I do recommend to bring your own towels as the ones we got were quite old, but they were clean. For the price we paid this was awesome, right in the center, near the tram, central station is just a 10 minute tram ride away. If you are just looking for a cheap place to sleep while you explore the city, this is the perfect place. If you want to stay at the hotel all day, you will need to book something way more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wenbow
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 2 star plus hotel then dont look here!!! . If you dont mind roughing it a bit, for a wild weekend with your mates, then this place is okay. It aint the best of places but it is cheap and cheerful, and bang in the middle of Leidesplien. The chaps that run it are fine and real helpful. If you plan on late nights, making lots of noise yourself , then this place is fine. It is not the sort of place you go to, and spend time relaxing in your room. Its more like up, shower and out... only come back to sleep. But we were all safe enough and had hot runnig water to shower. The beds werent the best, but we were all to stoned to worry.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrific - The Worst hotel IN THE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: Odgey2k
Reviews.Content: I NEVER write reviews as I'm honestly too lazy but I HAD to write this one just so that no one else goes through this horrible experience. We arrived at the hotel at 3:30pm, an hour and a half after check in time started, greeted by a scruffy pot head who needed a wash. The reception stank of Weed and made us feel quite sick. The room wasn't ready and we were told it wasn't their fault but the guests' who stayed there before because they hadn't left yet!! We were told to go wander around and come back around 5-6pm! Luckily when I complained (as we had friends to meet) they took us upstairs to check if the room was ready (so this wasn't even known to them or not) and said we could have the room. Here's a list of the problems: The window wouldn't shut - a 2" gap to be precise letting all kinds of nightlife sound freely into the room on one of Amsterdam's busiest streets. The toilet had a leak in the U-Bend meaning each flush would allow water to overflow all over the bathroom floor - I repeat TOILET WATER The toilet hadn't been flushed after the last guests had used it - it was dirty The sink had bits of what looked like Vomit all over it There was no toilet paper There were no towels, finally we were given towel which had stains in them and were ancient. The shower was broken. The TV didn't work The photos were not real We were woken up the following day by the strange looking housekeeper (male) who was actually IN THE ROOM standing AT THE EDGE OF THE BED, he had not knocked the door and the room has no intercom so of course we hadn't received any call to wake us up. All in all a HORRIBLE experience and I'd advise anyone considering the hotel to strongly reconsider! HOWEVER the location was central, But then so are the Park Benches (and they're free!)

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Abby021
Reviews.Content: We arrived with very low expectations however it wasn't as bad as expected. Room was very well heated and had the essentials, towels clean sheet etc. Was very noisy so wouldn't stay there unless you are unable to sleep through noise, bed was comfortable and staff were very helpful when booking taxi to the airport. Breakfast was standard cheese, bread, ham, eggs .. filled us up for the day. Brilliant location close walk to anything and plenty of inexpensive resturants to eat at and bars to go to. Booked through expedia and it promised more than it gave to be honest but considering we visited the city for sightseeing we only really used the hotel to sleep and it was comfortable for that. Overall, good trip, friendly staff and no major complaints, if your looking for somewhere cheap with good location to bars, clubs and resturants then it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_alotEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest place I have ever stayed in! I got the impression it was probably a proper hotel about 20 years ago and then the management decided a good way to cut cost was to stop maintaining it. I expect the pictures advertising the hotel were taken before the maintenance stopped. Be warned, this hotel now looks nothing like the pictures! The thing that really got me was the state of the bathroom. The shower was literally black with mould. The dampness was so bad it had caused holes in the ceiling right above the toilet. I did wonder if there could be a camera at the other side of these holes (it would not surprise me with this place). Then when you come out the shower you get to dry yourself with a 20-year-old towel with nice big holes in it. The door of the room didn't lock right as it had been kicked in at some point and never sorted. None of the lights worked because they had no bulbs in them. The bed linen had the same problem as the towels and it did make you wonder how many bed bugs you were sleeping with. I noticed three reviews actually gave this place 5 stars. Two of these review weren't in English so I can't comment. The one that was in English is from someone called Bill. He calls everyone that complains about this place â€œCry babiesâ€�. He recommends this place to everyone he knows, even pregnant women. I notice he was very concerned that when all these â€œCry babiesâ€� go home they write bad things and hurt the nice owners business. I did notice his review was in broken English. Could â€œBillâ€� really be the owner? Maybe if he maintained the hotel people would stop saying bad things about it. Don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a drunken weekend”
Reviews.Author: Pokerbhoy
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here for a STAG doo recently and this hotel was perfect for us. Fair enough, my room didnt have running water, it was dirty, there were stains on the sheets and a condom (hopefully unused) over the fire alarm presumably to allow people to smoke without setting it off. But apart from all that it did just the trick for our drunken weekend! Perfect location and if you are in Amsterdam with a group of lads then this place is ideal- its cheap and you can make as much noise as you like! Whilst in Amsterdam you wont be spending very much time in your room anyway so there really is no point spending extra for a "clean" hotel. I would recommend this hotel for drunken weekends with mates but NOT suitable for a romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Fake photos, beware!”
Reviews.Author: ChristianeMScotland
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel in Amsterdam at the last minute, and there was little choice left because of a large congress going on, so I plunged for this one without checking it out. What a mistake! For a price of Â£65 per night, special offer down from Â£ 85 according to expedia, I did not expect luxury, but neither this: I had rung the doorbell for 5 minutes when another guest let me in, and it took another few minutes until the hotel owner appeared in a football shirt and grubby trousers. When I asked him where to get the breakfast, it turned out that it was not included in the price because there was none on offer â€œonly my son does one in his hotel down the roadâ€�. The steep and narrow staircase led to an attic room with one chair, two double beds, three night tables with one ashtray and three lamps, but there was no light connected to the switch at the door. The small wardrobe had 4 plastic shop hangers, one still with the label for the clothes size. There was no phone, the lamp next to the TV had neither bulb nor shade, and where the plaster board crumbled on the wall, there was a paper sticker - to hold it together? The only thing renewed in the bathroom in the last forty years had been the toilet. There were two bare bulbs on the ceiling, but neither soap nor any kind of glass by the sink. The good feature was the location: straight in the middle of dozens of bars and pubs to choose from, but that was also the bad feature: even with closed window the beat from the disco underneath kept me awake until three. All this seems bad enough, but the really bad news were the standards of hygiene. My heart already sank when I waited outside the front door and I saw the carpet on the staircase: the dirtiest one I have ever seen in my life, and the walls hadnâ€™t been painted in forty years I guess. Up to reception the handrail was fake brass, up to the first floor plastic, and from then on wood where the paint had peeled off and it was sticky from many sweaty hands. When I opened to door to the room, the first thing that hit me was the smell of must and cigarettes. The carpet had loads of holes and loads of stains. When I took the bed cover away I found a crisp clean pillow case and sheet, but the pillow case was open on the side and unfortunately I got a glimpse of the pillow underneath. When I picked up the duvet, there was dark fluff underneath and it looked as if somebody had already slept in it; I checked out the other three, but they all looked the same. But even if it had been washed and they just never bother ironing those, I wonder where it picked up the fluff. And finally there was the shower: the ceiling covered in mould, signs of more mould in the grouting and the bottom end of the shower curtain was a rotting orange. And when, in desperation, I tried to have a shower nevertheless, the water did not come from the shower head, but poured from a hole in the pipe at the bottom. Although the room was already paid for through expedia, I tried to get another hotel, but only succeeded for the second night, so had no choice but spending the first one there. When I handed my keys in in the morning and told them I would not come back in the evening because the place was so awful, the only response was â€œThatâ€™s alright. Not to worry.â€� They are obviously used to people walking out on themâ€¦.. What a relief it was to step into a clean room and have a shower the next evening at the IBIS - all the way out at the airport, but who cares! Although the tripadvisor, as I have now seen too late, has plenty of reviews with warnings, you would not expect any of this when you see the official photos on the site. But beware: neither this reception nor the nice and clean receptionist exist in the hotel! (To start with, there is no window behind the actual reception desk.) Maybe thatâ€™s the sonâ€™s hotel down the road that the owner mentioned, but certainly has never ever been the Leidseplein Hotel in which I have stayed. Overall: by far the worst hotel I have been in since the youth hostel in Avignon in 1972! Anyone remembers that hell hole?

Reviews.Title: “My experience was not THAT bad...”
Reviews.Author: maggie_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: I laughted out loud when reading all these reviews. I really feel bad for people who had such a horrible stay. I have to agree its perfect for a stoners weekend. I stayed in a lovely big room with 3 of my friends. We weren't at the hotel much, but had the time of our lives there! you can't expect much, when you don't pay much. I think this place is brilliant for budget (young) travellers. They have no system in place for laundry, so when I handed mine in we never knew where it went. I got it back two days later (cleaned and not ironed) and was never charged for it. We still think that the child that worked at reception (I swear this boy can't be older than 12) took it home and asked his mom to do it for me!! Anyway, good place for people who just want to enjoy Amsterdam on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: Management is not mentally stable and unclean”
Reviews.Author: whydoihavetodothis
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to lie--I laughed at the hotel reviews on here before I stayed at the hotel. Then, I realized they were all true. The management is absolutely whack. The man asked my friend (a girl) if she wanted to join him in watching a porn. The woman is Mr. Hyde/Dr. Jeckel. She was so friendly the first day or so. When we were checking out, she made up a checkout fee of 20 euros and claimed she told us about it, which definitely never happened. She's just money-hungry. She didn't want us to have a third room because she didn't want to have to "wash" more sheets. We had to come back to get something, and we did this by completely avoiding her, but she waved to us like we were best friends.The location is pretty good because there are lots of restaurants. I don't know where the picture for this hotel came from, but it definitely isn't this hotel. You see cleaning equipment everywhere. Don't let this fool you. Notice how it never moves. The bathroom had blood on the floor, and the shower had no barrier with the rest of the bathroom, so water went everywhere. The doorknobs are all broken. Both knobs for the bathroom didn't even attach--it was just lying on the floor when we arrived. Cool. It might be worth staying here if you want to see hilarious key rings. One of ours looked like a metal cone, and the other one was just like a metal booey. The stairs were narrow and steep. Also, it is right across from a club, and the windows don't shut completely, so the noise comes in, and it is quite hard to sleep. Think of it this way: when you stay in a hotel, you expect things to be clean and comfortable. This place wasn't that, so why would one pay to stay in a place that isn't kept up? Just find a hotel without borderline mentally unstable management, and you will be happy. This place should be shut down for health code violations.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent for stoners”
Reviews.Author: natural_mystic82
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed over a long weekend. We got given a quad room that was huge with 4 single beds. It has it's own toilet and shower that were adequate and worked. The room had 4 large windows and let in lots of light. The town centre was about 15 mins walk from there, so location was ideal. You can smoke whatever youwant in the hotel which was a big bonus as not many hotels let you do this any more. Overall it's a basic hotel with working armenities. Good for a short city break with friends. If you are looking for somehting nice and romantic, please look at paying more. for a stoners holiday, simply perfect. Oh yeah staff at the hotel are also very friendly and more than happy to tell you about the local area and where things are.

Reviews.Title: “JUST DON`T GO”
Reviews.Author: anne4Uk
Reviews.Content: There is not words to describe how awful and bad is this place that must not be called hotel, is a crappie dirty place, the first impression is that your walking in a hostel for homeless people (and those are ten thousand times much better than this place) dirty carpets, dirty stained walls and doors, bad smell, we went in to the room, not very convinced about to stay as we open the door things werenâ€™t getting worst ,the bathroom was so mouldy that the smell was difficult to resist. We complaint and they agree to send us to another hotel. The place is a threat to the health of any human be it should be closed by the health authorities in Netherland.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: theCulk
Reviews.Content: I usually never write these sort of reviews. Usually they are very misleading. But not for this place. They mucked up our booking, so had only 1 room available. I ended up on the floor on a spare matress. my iPod got stolen out of my room. we had to haggle to pay the bill eventhough we had printouts of all charges sent to us by the hotel themselves. please please heed all the bad reviews of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Believe The Other Reviews!!! (They're All True)”
Reviews.Author: daveboyle
Reviews.Content: I thought, "ah I'll chance it - it'll be fine" when I booked the Leidseplein Hotel for my Fiancee & Friend, but it wasn'. Every bad review I read was accurate. They [--] up the booking, leaving my buddy on the floor of my room for one of the nights, and for the pleasure of that one of the cleaning staff stole his mp3 player. They didn't give a [--] about actually cleaning the rooms, and in the end the half-baked guy behind the counter tried to overcharge us. Amsterdam is a beautiful city, and the Leidseplein area is a great spot, but KEEP AWAY FROM THE LEIDSEPLEIN HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst place in the world”
Reviews.Author: alexilalas
Reviews.Content: I made reservation five months ago, to prevent problems with our holidays in Aâ€™dam, considering that 30th April was National Holyday Queenâ€™s Birthday in Netherlands. The Hotel don't honored my confirmed reservation by Easytobook.com, saying that he don't have it. We was obliged to sleep divided in two hotels for the first night, and, on our return to Leidseplein they put us in a double room (2 persons) and in a quadruple room (the remaining 6 persons!) saying us that the room was larger as for 6 persons. The room wasnâ€™t. The hotel simply put two mattresses on the floor, in strictly contact with a dirty carpeting! Thereâ€™s not necessary space for all 6 bed so allocated: closet was unusable due to the impossibility to open his doors, thereâ€™s no space between beds, so was really unfit to reach the bed, thereâ€™s no space for the luggage, six luggage putted on the floor, and everytime we need clothes was necessary to open luggage â€˜cause we havenâ€™t closet! The hotel was really dirty, clean service donâ€™t clean nothing in 3 days, more broken supplies (doors, windows), we donâ€™t have towels available, and on our request, the hotel give us in the late afternoon: dirty and wet! We sleeped with a mouse trap in room! There isnâ€™t telephone (needed to frequently speak with reception considering all our problems!), television donâ€™t works, minibar was closed and inaccessible. If You want, Iâ€™ll be glad to send You more photos about this situation, so Youâ€™ll be able to confront them with photo on every website! They says it's normal to put mattresses on a dirty floor, that was normal to put 6 persons in a quadruple room with all consequent problems. This weekend would was a pleasant holidays. Leidseplein Hotel transform it in an hell! Make a present to You: DON'T RESERVE HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Venere.com and this hotel are both UNRELIABLE”
Reviews.Author: ECTBruges
Reviews.Content: Our confirmed reservation via venere.com was not honored. Complaining to Venere they tell me it is the fault of the Liedesplein. I simply suggest to avoid both services. I do want, however to thank the very nice lady at the reception desk who worked very hard to find us another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HET LEIDSEPLEIN NOT FOR YOU!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryJanie
Reviews.Content: Don't rely on a CONFIRMED reservation if you want to stay here. Our confirmed reservation was NOT HONOURED when we arrived to check in today. On the other hand, when you arrive and your reservation is not worth the paper it's printed on, if you want help finding a hostel at an inconvenient location AFTER you arrive on a late train, and AFTER all restaurants are closed in the area, they will give you directions and an unreadable, incomplete map similar to the one they send with the reservation. This makes looking for alternate accomodations SO MUCH FUN, particularly when you are lugging baggage around.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a lot of young people”
Reviews.Author: sweety2707
Reviews.Content: Leidseplein Hotel is a nice little hotel right in the middle of Leidseplein square. There are tons of little restaurants right in front of the door, which makes it really nice to go out even at night. The hotel is small but definitely ok for a stay or a couple more. the rooms were surprisingly big but the beds were kind of old. if you are not a young person it might not be the hotel you want to stay at because there are a lot of youngsters running around even at night and smoking in the hallways. I didn't mind, since me and my boyfriend were out the most time. we had a nice room with a nice view to the road with all the restaurants. we also came back again a year later and it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: easypeasy69
Reviews.Content: Really good location right in the middle of the square right opposite a sports cafe showing pretty much all major events and whatever else is on. Burger king is about a minutes walk and there is numerous bars, clubs and cafes on the doorstep. Smoking is allowed in the room including weed! Hotel is a bit of a dump and the decor is very tired but room was clean enough and towels were changed everyday and for a group of a lads a clean bed and somewhere to crash were all we were really after.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At The Leidseplein Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkilroy8888
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of it's location. It was the dirtiest rundown hotel we have ever encountered. We are very flexible travelers and can absorb much. The furniture was falling apart (literally a piece of the closet fell off and cut my face), there were rodent traps in the corners, the linens were beyond rundown, the toilet was broken and leaking, and the carpet worn through. The owners clearly are praying on unsuspecting travelers who choose this hotel for it's location. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather have slept on the pavement!”
Reviews.Author: brinker
Reviews.Content: Utterly abismal. The picture on the website is not even of the same building, the shower was a a cold drip, the breakfast was hard cheese, the windows wouldn't close and so it was noisy and cold, they didn't have a duvae so we had to just have sheets. I have been with 2 friends many times to the Dam, and am aware that many hotels are cheap and you often get what you pay for, and ultimately, you come back in such a state after a day out that you only want a room with a bed. Unfortunately, this hotel didn't even get that right. It's a disgrace and there are better hotels about for the same money. The only good thing is it's near a Burger King and even that was full of tramps!

Reviews.Title: “Not for those with disabilities”
Reviews.Author: quintulsulp
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Slap bang in the middle of Leidseplein, next to all the night life, 2 minutes walk from tram stops. Nowhere near the red light district and a fair distance from the train station but there are regular trams to it. Great if you want to party all night but avoid if y ou like to be in bed by 10, it's directly opposite a really loud and busy club which doesnt shut up til about 3.30am and there's no double glazing. ACCESS 24 hours access (you get given a front door key) although they lock the front door at 11 so if you intend to check in after that its best to ring them. Absolutely not suitable for anyone with mobility problems...its a flight of stairs to reception then another to the first floor of rooms, I think there are 3 floors of rooms so a minimum of 2 flights of stairs and no lift. The stairs are also very narrow with very narrow steps so if you are planning on going out and getting wasted be aware you will have a mammoth task in front of you getting back! STAFF We had very little to do with them but they seemed very friendly and polite and efficient. FACILITIES Rooms are basic. They are kept clean and cleaned and tidied every day but decor is tired. Bedlinen is very old and very thin (not great if you have an incredibly slow metabolism like me!) No air con, marks on the carpets but it was clean. Our window was propped open by a paving slab. TV with lots of channels including english. We had an ensuite which again was basic and old but clean and perfectly adequate. Some damp patches especially in the ceiling outside our door. Basically its an old building that probably needs refurbishing but as their main clientele are probably drunks who are going to make a mess and just want cheap accomodation why bother, it's not cost effective, the location pretty much limits it to party animals. I must stress though, the rooms were clean (and we weren't disturbed once by any other patrons). There is a bar in reception but we didn't use it and never saw anyone else use it, you're so close to so many bars why bother with the hotel one? TO BE AWARE Breakfast isn't free, they charge 5 euros a person a day. We didn't take this up as there are plenty of places to eat nearby (avoid the breakfast at the Bulldog Cafe though, it's rubbish) so I have no idea how good it is. On top of the price they charge for room there is a 5% tourist tax which is standard for amsterdam however this hotel also charges another 5% if you want to pay by your card so I would reccomend getting enough cash out (there's an ATM on the square about a 2 minute walk away but it doesn't always work) If you just want a cheap place to crash after a hard nights partying this hotel is perfect. Otherwise I'd probably suggest looking for somewhere a bit quieter.

Reviews.Title: “stuff has been fixed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything work tv, we got hot water but that was about it we stayed on the top floor of the building so 4 flights of steep stair to climb after a nightout was the best thing in the world. Rooms were ok but it was boiling in them one window and having the door open still didnt work could get a daught up there. servic wasnt good out room never got clean bedding or towel we only got them when i manage to get from the cleaner who was 2 floors below us cleaning he never came up 2 our floor only til the day we left. Breakfast we got for free as we argue them down say our price included the breakfast so dont give in. location excellent just shame about the noise at 4am in moring with the clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Sqwat comes to mined”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many place's and we would"nt let our dog have stayed in rooms 11 & 12.The heating did"nt work & showers were still as cold as they where 6 months ago.The staff did evey thing they could to help(what a joke) STAY HERE AT OWN RISK.

Reviews.Title: “What is Dutch for 'Bllluuuurrrrkk'?”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHeart
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons to avoid this hotel. Steep stairs, no hot water over a freezing new years weekend, toilet operated by a piece of coat hanger wire that sticks out from the top of the cistern, no TV or fridge (present but faulty), steep stairs, thin walls (with or without rats), mystery 'errors' with our room rate that saw staff ask for an additional %15 after check-in. The front door is plastered with credit card stickers yet the system was out of action on our arrival we had to pay cash, even though there was a manual card swipe machine resting on the window ledge. Avoid avoid avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is the pits. There was no hot water for the entire 5 days we stayed there. The TV, fridge & phones didn't work, there were no overhead lights only lamps, which did not give enough light. We had two rooms in this hostel and both rooms were as bad as each other. Our bathroom did not have a shower recess so water went everywhere, messy. We never received towels; we always had to ask after 10.30pm and then were given grief when we asked for more to clean up the water in the bathroom. The reception staff (bar one lady) were all unhelpful every time we complained about the water etc. The ended up telling us lies about things getting fixed for us to leave them alone. They also invented a tourist tax of 5%, which they insisted we pay & then denied our group of 9 of paying a deposit, which they then tried to charge us again. The location was fantastic but everything else was terrible. Apparently the place has not had hot water in over 2 months. Do not stay here; warn all the people you know.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty bedsheets, smelly bedroom, dirty toilets, 4 flights of steep staircases...avoid it by all means unless you have the energy to climb up the stairs with your luggages! And the breakfast was not included as promised too.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but a large clean room, friendly staff, and very good location. Really ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean large room. Nice toilet/wash facilities. The location is very good. The leidseplein is easy to get to on the trams. Staff were all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to stay away from”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to amsterdam last february and stayed in this hotel. It looked quite good on from the pictures on the internet site (hoteladvice) i booked it through. For a budget hotel I thought yes that look good. That was until I arrived. It was a stale old horrible room. Nothing was working. The safe was broken and the door was hanging off the mini bar. Which looked like it was about 50 years old. We had a tv in the room but unfortunately all we could see was snow. the bed clothes were definately ancient and smelly. We more of less just slept in the room for the weekend and no more. So everybody do yourself a favour and stay well clear. There are plenty of nice clean budget hotels out there. And to Hoteladvice you should seriously review the pictures of the rooms on your site because they dont look remotely like the on i stayed in.

HotelInfo.Name: Leidseplein Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Korte Leidsedwarsstraat 79, Amsterdam 1017 PW, The Netherlands
